metadata.title: CVE-2019-18677 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Squid 3.x and 4.x through 4.8 when theappend_domain setting is used (because the appended characters do notproperly interact with hostname length restrictions). Due to incorrectmessage processing, it can inappropriately redirect traffic to origins itshould not be delivered to.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-cgi - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-common - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-purge - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid3 - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squidclient - 4.9-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9-2ubuntu1').
